Description: Rim and neck sherd of Corinthian, probably black-figured Red Ground pottery krater of Chalcidian type; pale orange slip; tall, slightly concave rim; interior glazed black with two added red bands below rim; top of rim glazed; exterior: dotted net pattern on rim (three-tiered lozenge chain with black and added white dots; black band above and below); neck black with white dot rosette with added red core (only traces remaining); glazed ridge at turn to shoulder.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the neck amphora Louvre E640, Payne (1931), pl. 40, no. 1.
Bibliographic references: Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 330, no. 1485)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 222, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.215) (phase 3)
